title: "Mahratta 25" art deco facade lettering
content:
Hello type recognition geniae   
I've been asked to match the accompanying from the facade of an old art deco building. Is this a standard font or perhaps a hand drawn conglomerate? ![Mahratta](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225020im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48816.jpg)
author: jeremy_matthews

comments.content: I don't know it but they should have kerned the letters.
Does anybody at all have a handle on this one?

Closest I've found is [classic roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225020/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/classic-roman/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=60&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=MAHRATTA) but it's not an exact match.

Also not an exact match, but [Paul Lloyd's](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225020/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/index.htm) Imperator yields this (kerning left "as is"):   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225020im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49045.gif)
